CatDescriptText: Mr. Donald Carter, janitor, 1931 Charles Street, North Side and Mr. John O'Connor, truck driver, Oakland, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think political leaders, who have been granted the power of seeking or dispensing patronage should "take care" of their immediate family and relatives before they do such supporters like committee men and committee women and financial contributors?"  Mr. Carter's answer reads: "They should take care of the supporters, because they are the ones who put the leaders into office."  Mrs. O'Connor's answer reads: "They should take car of the best qualified persons, regardless of whether they are of the supporter's immediate family or political party, or of the opposition..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donald Carter wearing plaid suit jacket, standing in front of buildings and back of truck; Portrait of John O'Connor wearing plaid button down collared shirt, standing in front of buildings
